subtitle: This light and zesty dessert is the perfect end to a lovely meal.

method.text: Place the orange and lemon rind and juice in a pan. Add half the sugar and the water. Heat gently until the sugar dissolves.

Add water to the cornflour and mix to a smooth paste. Stir into the orange and lemon mixture until well blended. Bring to the boil, stirring continuously. Cook for 1 min until thickened. Cool the mixture slightly. Beat in the egg yolks, one at a time.
Pour the warm citrus filling into the pastry case, levelling the surface.
Whisk the egg whites until stiff. Whisk in half the caster sugar a little at a time. Carefully fold in the remainder.

Spoon the meringue into a polythene bag fitted with a star nozzle. Pipe rosettes of meringue over the filling, being sure to cover it completely. Place in the oven for about 35 min. Serve warm or cold.

title: St Clements meringue pie
